question: When log(p/1-p)=a+bx, what does "a" represent?
C: Change in log of odds for one unit of x

question: Suppose p is the probability of acceptance of Med school and x is GPA. If log(p/1-p)=a+bx, what does "b" represent?
A: Change in log of odds for one unit of x

question: Suppose x=1 for the treatment group and x=0 for the control group. When log(p/1-p)=a+bx, what does "b" represent?
B: Change in odds for one unit of x
